result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps was found guilty of Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 9 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge.

No firearms; weapons.
Defendant to turnover all firearms and provide proof at the probation review hearing.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
This time is stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.

12-04-15/ Judge Ellen R Brostrom
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-04-15 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time in the HOC

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps not in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 9 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Defendant to turnover all firearms and provide proof at the probation review hearing.
-Provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss is granted by the Court without prejudice.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/02/15 in Branch 40.  State will hold the offer open until 8/26/15.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
With no objection from the defense, Court ordered 15CM1454 and 15CM2027 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Case NOT set for court appearance. Matter called at request of the state.  State's motion to join 15CM2027, 15CM1454, 15CM2123 for trial taken under advisement. Matter set over to branch 40 to address joinder motion, converted the final pretrial date. Court VACATED Jury Trial date, state advised court more time is needed between the motion hearing date and the trial date. Case adjourned to branch 40.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM023008  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/04/2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BRITTANY B. AND JAKYE H-B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Darrell Donnell Hardwick-Epps in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
